climbs.name: Wall of Voodoo
climbs.fa: Brad Holroyd, Brad (Chum) Carter, Kirk Brode  (spring 2003)

content.description: This last pitch of this climb has gotta be the most exposed at T-Wall.  Pulling the final roof up here you look out at the entire sweep of the cliff as it curves away on both sides.  It doesn't get any more exposed in the state of Tennessee.  High adventure at the T-Wall.
content.location: Locate obvious 15' roof crack on Upper tier. Pretty much in the center of the cliff somewhere above Prerequisite for Excellence.  Climb crux roof to stance and belay.  Climb overhanging second pitch to remarkable overhang.  Exposed.

content.description:
This obscure route has been unreported for over 12 years.  Climb Open Sesame and scramble up to the Upper Tier.  Located a large cave like overhang with an obvious wide crack climbing out of it.  If you make it this far you'll know what the route name refers to.   

  Has probably not seen a second ascent.  A route only for those seeking an adventure way off the beaten path.
content.location: Pretty much directly above Open Sesame on the upper tier.

content.description: The Upper cliff band of the Tenneseee Wall.  Not great rock but a few gems here and there.  A great adventure to climb up here.  Beautiful views and total solitude.
